LOL!!!!!!!!!!!!

Sandra.....girlfriend........ROFL

Kim

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 449
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/26/2002 3:53:56 AM Central Daylight Time, ... I can relate...... If they have room they normally let me and the kids get a bedroom since
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/26/2002 3:53:56 AM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> > This 30 day pass with Amtrak seems like a good idea but its
> > coach class so me and the spawn will be sitting upright for the 3
> > days it takes to get to CA. Anyone know how comfortable those
> > seats are?
>
> I think they're pretty okay - not like airplaines, at least - get the ones
> that face each other with a table between - The armrests come up - small
> people can probably lay across two seats. The seat backs go back pretty
> far.
> You can put your head on the table - more options. And on long trips there
> are observation cars. Cool.
>
> A couple of us moms folded origami for the couple of hours it took us on a
> recent train ride between Orange County, CA and San Diego. The kids sat at
> another table and played some kind of elaborate card and character game.

I can relate......
If they have room they normally let me and the kids get a bedroom since hubby
is normally working when we travel or I will get a employee dorm room if they
are full since I don't have to pay for it........
Being a wife to an employee for them for 20 years....


My husband works the chicago to oakland....
Which one are you going on? I can see if he would be working that particular
trip and I can have him take care of you regarding the lounge car......

Kimberley


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
